emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: AI algorithms that dynamically adjust contract terms based on real-time data and predefined conditions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases efficiency in contract management but could lead to job displacement in legal sectors.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires legal framework adjustments, trust in AI decision-making, and integration with existing blockchain systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations
emerging_technologies.description: Use of blockchain for governance and operations of space missions, ensuring transparency and democratic decision-making.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could democratize space exploration but raises issues around space law and international cooperation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High costs, international regulations, and technological maturity are key barriers.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Tokens representing energy units traded on decentralized platforms for energy distribution and consumption.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes renewable energy use but requires significant changes in energy policy and infrastructure.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for widespread blockchain adoption, regulatory acceptance, and consumer trust in tokenized systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Applications
emerging_technologies.description: Applications that allow verification of transactions without revealing underlying data.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances privacy and security but might complicate law enforcement and regulatory oversight.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on proving effectiveness, scalability, and integration with existing systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: Neural Interfaces
mainstream_technologies.description: Interfaces allowing direct communication between the brain and external devices.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly used in healthcare, gaming, and personal computing, with regulatory frameworks adapting to ensure safety and privacy.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Transport Networks
mainstream_technologies.description: Self-driving vehicles and drones that operate within a decentralized network.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in logistics and public transport, with significant infrastructure investments driving adoption.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies that shift control from centralized entities to individuals or community governance.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes equality and participation but challenges existing power structures and regulatory frameworks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing push for transparency, accountability, and individual empowerment through technology.

epoch_themes.description: Development of technologies aimed at reducing environmental impact and ensuring equitable access.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Addresses climate change and economic disparity, fostering a new era of responsible technology use.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global movement towards sustainability, with policies and investments in green technology.
